document_data.name: The Wanton Wyvern

document_data.mainbody: '''The Wanton Wyvern''' was a tavern near the [[Hullack Forest]] during the mid-14{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.Location: The tavern was just outside the western edge of [[Hullack Forest]], close to the [[East Way]], which traveled through the forest west towards [[Arabel]].
document_data.Structure: The construction was sprawling. The rooms were simple, but warm and clean. The galleries had low ceilings.

Interior.Atmosphere: The inside of the tavern was dusty and dark. The rooms were simple, but warm and clean. There were a number of ragged standards hanging from the walls, which had once been spoils of battle. The tavern's indoor walls were wooden, rather than stone.

document_data.Services: Besides food, the place had the amenities for a bath.{{cite book/Crown of Fire/TPB 2002|138-142|8}}
document_data.Defenses: The tavern was protected by a tall fence and gate. A shield hanging by the gate labeled "Strike to enter" was used by travelers to signal to the staff. Inside, a number of loaded [[crossbow]]s were kept, hanging ready behind the bar.
document_data.History: [[Mirt]] suggested heading for the Wanton Wyvern to [[Shandril Shessair]] after joining her at [[Tethgard]] during her voyage from [[the Dalelands]] to [[Silverymoon]] in {{yearlink|1357}}. On exiting Hullack Forest, they arrived at the Wanton Wyvern within the night. They met [[Baergasra]], a friend of Mirt's, in passing. They also met [[Thomd]], the innkeeper. While inside, Shandril briefly dozed off; when she woke up, [[Osber]], a local [[Zhentarim]] fighter, attempted to capture her. During the fight, [[Narm Tamaraith]], Shandril's husband, was poisoned. Mirt called upon Baergasra's help, and Thomd was told to draw her a bath.
document_data.Inhabitants: Osber was a regular at the tavern. Baergasra, disguised as a leprous beggar, spent two years at the gate to spy on tavern-goers. Thomd was an innkeeper for at least that long.
